metadata.Title: CVE-2012-3826 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer underflows in Wireshark 1.4.x before 1.4.13 and 1.6.x before 1.6.8 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (loop) via vectors related to the R3 dissector, a different vulnerability than CVE-2012-2392.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3826` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.6.8-1ubuntu1
libwireshark11 - 1.6.8-1ubuntu1
libwiretap8 - 1.6.8-1ubuntu1
libwscodecs2 - 1.6.8-1ubuntu1
libwsutil9 - 1.6.8-1ubuntu1
tshark - 1.6.8-1ubuntu1
wireshark - 1.6.8-1ubuntu1
wireshark-common - 1.6.8-1ubuntu1
wireshark-gtk - 1.6.8-1ubuntu1
wireshark-qt - 1.6.8-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.8-1ubuntu1').
